header: Bail Appln.No. 137/2019 CNR-MHPU01-000536-2019 ORDER BELOW EXH. 1

background.text: 1. This is an application under Sec. 439 of Cr.P.C. for grant of bail pending trial. On the basis of the report lodged by informant C.R.No. 964/2018 under Sec. 406, 407 r/w 34 of I.P.C. has been registered with Shirur Police Station.

arguments.text: 2. It is alleged by the prosecution that informant Salim Hamid Kazi lodged report with Shirur Police Station by alleging that he is running transport business by name and style 'Sarkar Roadlines'. He is having Eicher tempo No. MH-11/AL-3800 and accused No. 1 Rohit Chandgude is appointed as a driver on the said tempo 21.11.2018. Thereafter, informant had entered with agreement with one firm I.N.I. at Daud Taluka and gave his tempo to above firm on rental basis for carrying pomegranate fruit. Informant further alleged that on 09.12.2018 accused Rohit left from I.N.I. Farm Wasunde along with 292 empty carets and went to district Jalana to bring pomegranate fruits. Thereafter, accused No. 1 picked-up 5,840 Kg. Pomegranate fruits from Jalana district on 10.12.2018 and proceeded towards Pune, however accused did not reach at I.N.I. Farm, Daund till night. Hence, company staff contacted to informant, however driver's mobile was switched off. Thereafter, on 14.12.2018 accused found along with empty tempo at Shirur. In short accused sold the pomegranate fruits to K.D.Choudhary at Market Yard and misappropriated the sale proceeds.

argumentSentences.text: It is alleged by the prosecution that informant Salim Hamid Kazi lodged report with Shirur Police Station by alleging that he is running transport business by name and style 'Sarkar Roadlines'.
He is having Eicher tempo No.
MH-11/AL-3800 and accused No. 1 Rohit Chandgude is appointed as a driver on the said tempo 21.11.2018.
Thereafter, informant had entered with agreement with one firm I.N.I. at Daud Taluka and gave his tempo to above firm on rental basis for carrying pomegranate fruit.
Informant further alleged that on 09.12.2018 accused Rohit left from I.N.I. Farm Wasunde along with 292 empty carets and went to district Jalana to bring pomegranate fruits.
Thereafter, accused No. 1 picked-up 5,840 Kg.
Pomegranate fruits from Jalana district on 10.12.2018 and proceeded towards Pune, however accused did not reach at I.N.I. Farm, Daund till night.
Hence, company staff contacted to informant, however driver's mobile was switched off.
Thereafter, on 14.12.2018 accused found along with empty tempo at Shirur.
In short accused sold the pomegranate fruits to K.D.Choudhary at Market Yard and misappropriated the sale proceeds.

arguments.text: 3. By this application applicant contends that he has not committed any offence but has been falsely implicated. His name is not appearing in he F.I.R. There is no recovery or discovery at the hands of present applicant. The investigation of the crime has been completed practically. Applicant is the only member in his family and family is depending upon him for livelihood. He is ready to abide the conditions imposed on him. Thus, applicant prayed for grant of bail.

argumentSentences.text: By this application applicant contends that he has not committed any offence but has been falsely implicated.
His name is not appearing in he F.I.R.
There is no recovery or discovery at the hands of present applicant.
The investigation of the crime has been completed practically.
Applicant is the only member in his family and family is depending upon him for livelihood.
He is ready to abide the conditions imposed on him.
Thus, applicant prayed for grant of bail.

arguments.text: 4. In response to the show cause notice prosecution has filed its say vide Exh. 3 thereby denied all adverse allegations and reiterated its case. It is contended that accused No. 1 is the prime accused and along with co-accused he has committed the offence. Accused have sold the said pomegranate. The transport bill and payment voucher are recovered. Applicant will not attend the fixed date of the proceeding. He will pressurize the informant and witnesses which create hurdle in the investigation. Thus, prosecution prayed for grant of appeal.

argumentSentences.text: In response to the show cause notice prosecution has filed its say vide Exh. 3 thereby denied all adverse allegations and reiterated its case.
It is contended that accused No. 1 is the prime accused and along with co-accused he has committed the offence.
Accused have sold the said pomegranate.
The transport bill and payment voucher are recovered.
Applicant will not attend the fixed date of the proceeding.
He will pressurize the informant and witnesses which create hurdle in the investigation.
Thus, prosecution prayed for grant of appeal.

arguments.text: 5. Heard Ld.Counsel for the applicant and Ld.A.P.P. for the State. Perused case papers. It appears that there are grounds for believing that information is well founded against the accused. During investigation vehicle used in the crime, empty carets, sale proceeds of pomegranate fruits are already recovered from the custody of the accused. Applicant is ready to co-operate the investigation. Considering nature of offence no purpose will be served by keeping the accused in jail till fling of charge-sheet. Thus, following order.

argumentSentences.text: Heard Ld.Counsel for the applicant and Ld.A.P.P.
for the State.
Perused case papers.
It appears that there are grounds for believing that information is well founded against the accused.
During investigation vehicle used in the crime, empty carets, sale proceeds of pomegranate fruits are already recovered from the custody of the accused.
Applicant is ready to co-operate the investigation.
Considering nature of offence no purpose will be served by keeping the accused in jail till fling of charge-sheet.
Thus, following order.

order.text: O R D E R 1. Cri.Bail Appln. No. 137/19 is hereby allowed. 2. Applicant accused Akshay Laxman Indalkar in C.R.No. 964/2018 registered with Shirur Police Station, be released on bail upon furnishing P.R.Bond in the sum of Rs. 30,000/- with one or two local sureties in the like amount. 3. He shall attend the concerned police station whenever directed by the I.O. in writing and co-operate the investigating officer in further investigation. 4. He shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of this case. 5. If the applicant committed breach of any conditions, the prosecution is at liberty to approach this court for cancellation of the bail.

footer: ( S. H. Gwalani ) Dt. : 22.01.2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune.
processedText:
Bail Appln.No. 137/2019 CNR-MHPU01-000536-2019 ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 
---header-ends---
1. This is an application under Sec. 439 of Cr.P.C. for grant of bail pending trial. On the basis of the report lodged by informant C.R.No. 964/2018 under Sec. 406, 407 r/w 34 of I.P.C. has been registered with Shirur Police Station. 
---background-ends---
2. It is alleged by the prosecution that informant Salim Hamid Kazi lodged report with Shirur Police Station by alleging that he is running transport business by name and style 'Sarkar Roadlines'. He is having Eicher tempo No. MH-11/AL-3800 and accused No. 1 Rohit Chandgude is appointed as a driver on the said tempo 21.11.2018. Thereafter, informant had entered with agreement with one firm I.N.I. at Daud Taluka and gave his tempo to above firm on rental basis for carrying pomegranate fruit. Informant further alleged that on 09.12.2018 accused Rohit left from I.N.I. Farm Wasunde along with 292 empty carets and went to district Jalana to bring pomegranate fruits. Thereafter, accused No. 1 picked-up 5,840 Kg. Pomegranate fruits from Jalana district on 10.12.2018 and proceeded towards Pune, however accused did not reach at I.N.I. Farm, Daund till night. Hence, company staff contacted to informant, however driver's mobile was switched off. Thereafter, on 14.12.2018 accused found along with empty tempo at Shirur. In short accused sold the pomegranate fruits to K.D.Choudhary at Market Yard and misappropriated the sale proceeds. 
---argument-ends---
3. By this application applicant contends that he has not committed any offence but has been falsely implicated. His name is not appearing in he F.I.R. There is no recovery or discovery at the hands of present applicant. The investigation of the crime has been completed practically. Applicant is the only member in his family and family is depending upon him for livelihood. He is ready to abide the conditions imposed on him. Thus, applicant prayed for grant of bail. 
---argument-ends---
4. In response to the show cause notice prosecution has filed its say vide Exh. 3 thereby denied all adverse allegations and reiterated its case. It is contended that accused No. 1 is the prime accused and along with co-accused he has committed the offence. Accused have sold the said pomegranate. The transport bill and payment voucher are recovered. Applicant will not attend the fixed date of the proceeding. He will pressurize the informant and witnesses which create hurdle in the investigation. Thus, prosecution prayed for grant of appeal. 
---argument-ends---
5. Heard Ld.Counsel for the applicant and Ld.A.P.P. for the State. Perused case papers. It appears that there are grounds for believing that information is well founded against the accused. During investigation vehicle used in the crime, empty carets, sale proceeds of pomegranate fruits are already recovered from the custody of the accused. Applicant is ready to co-operate the investigation. Considering nature of offence no purpose will be served by keeping the accused in jail till fling of charge-sheet. Thus, following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1. Cri.Bail Appln. No. 137/19 is hereby allowed. 2. Applicant accused Akshay Laxman Indalkar in C.R.No. 964/2018 registered with Shirur Police Station, be released on bail upon furnishing P.R.Bond in the sum of Rs. 30,000/- with one or two local sureties in the like amount. 3. He shall attend the concerned police station whenever directed by the I.O. in writing and co-operate the investigating officer in further investigation. 4. He shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of this case. 5. If the applicant committed breach of any conditions, the prosecution is at liberty to approach this court for cancellation of the bail. 
---order-ends---
( S. H. Gwalani ) Dt. : 22.01.2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune.
